Innovate and provide suggestions, planning, and development of new components as part of this active management and / or during the course of project assignments. ¬∑ Assist the Architect in the proper planning (communication, standards, education) in support of the successful transition from current state development tools, objects, infrastructures, and architectures to future state development tools, objects, infrastructures, and architectures.¬∑ Provide full support for all assigned Bank application systems and/or application infrastructure. System support includes, but is not limited to: problem resolution (business and non-business hours), user support, and system maintenance.¬∑ Design, prototype and develop components to be used in the development of the Banks software solutions.¬∑ Assist Application architect and end users in identifying and recommending automated solutions to business problems.¬∑ Accurately track and record hours worked on assigned projects/maintenance.¬∑ Assist in the evaluation and implementation of vendor-supplied solutions.¬∑ Provide assistance and direction to other engineers and developers, as AWS.¬∑ Strong understanding of Software engineering principles.¬∑ SOA, Design Patterns and Frameworks¬∑ Proficient in developing reusable components around commonly available frameworks.¬∑ Strong in performance engineering and trouble shooting.¬∑ Working knowledge of the following DBMS:o Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server¬∑ Proficient in gathering and analyzing data and drawing logical conclusions.¬∑ Strong understanding of other application servers in the market such as WebSphere or WebLogic.¬∑ Good working knowledge of the UNIX and Windows operating systems.¬∑ Familiar with project management techniques and one or more Systems Development Life Cycle methodologies.¬∑ Familiar with the evaluation, recommendation and implementation of vendor supplied solutions.¬∑ Knowledge of current technological trends in the software development industry.¬∑ Strong working knowledge of system integration issues between diverse platforms (PCs, UNIX, and Windows).Education ¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, computer science, or engineering preferred. Experience in lieu of education will be considered.

title: Risk Quant - Prime Brokerage

title: Ecommerce Software Engineer
description: Job Summary:The E-commerce software engineer is a key leadership position responsible for providing strategicguidance and direction for an e-commerce business technology initiatives. This role requires a deepunderstanding of both front-end and back-end technologies to optimize website performance, security,and scalability.Key Responsibilities:ÔÇ∑ Technology Strategy: Develop and communicate a technology strategy aligned with the e-commerce business goals.ÔÇ∑ Technology Roadmap: Create and manage a comprehensive technology roadmap that enhanceswebsite functionality and user experience.ÔÇ∑ Front-End and Back-End Expertise: Provide expert guidance on the selection, implementation,and integration of front-end and back-end technologies, frameworks, and platforms.ÔÇ∑ E-commerce Solutions: Identify and recommend e-commerce platforms, payment gateways,and solutions that best suit the business's needs.ÔÇ∑ Scalability: Ensure that the technology infrastructure is scalable to accommodate businessgrowth and sudden spikes in traffic.ÔÇ∑ Security and Compliance: Implement robust security measures to protect customer data andensure compliance with relevant regulations.ÔÇ∑ Performance Optimization: Develop strategies and best practices for optimizing websiteperformance, including page load times.ÔÇ∑ CDN Expertise: Leverage a deep understanding of CDN services, including platforms likeCloudflare, Akamai, and others, to guide the implementation and configuration of CDN solutionsfor optimized website performance, security, and scalability.ÔÇ∑ Cloud Computing Proficiency: Utilize comprehensive knowledge of cloud computing platforms(e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to recommend and oversee the adoption of cloud-basedsolutions that enhance the scalability, flexibility, and efficiency of the e-commerceinfrastructure.ÔÇ∑ Database Knowledge and Collaboration: Ensure that database management systems areoptimized for data storage, retrieval, and management, aligning with the e-commerce business'sneeds for data security, performance, and scalability. Collaborate with external DatabaseAdministrators (DBAs) and consultants while maintaining a fundamental understanding ofdatabase technology.ÔÇ∑ Data Analytics: Promote the use of data analytics tools to derive insights and drive data-informed decisions for marketing, sales, and user experience improvement.ÔÇ∑ Vendor and Team Management: Oversee relationships with technology vendors and internaldevelopment teams, providing leadership and direction.ÔÇ∑ Continuous Evaluation: Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and trends in e-commerce,evaluating their potential for adoption.Qualifications:ÔÇ∑ Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.ÔÇ∑ Proven experience in a technology leadership role within the e-commerce sector.ÔÇ∑ Expertise in front-end and back-end technologies, frameworks, and developmentmethodologies.ÔÇ∑ Knowledge of e-commerce platforms, payment gateways, and industry best practices.ÔÇ∑ Strong project management and leadership skills.ÔÇ∑ Business acumen, with the ability to align technology strategies with business objectives.ÔÇ∑ Excellent communication and collaboration skills.ÔÇ∑ Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description: Job Description & ResponsibilitiesWe're looking for a full stack software engineer who will be responsible for software development and support of Persistent Systems‚Äô industry-leading Wave Relay¬Æ mobile ad-hoc networking (MANET) system. You will be heavily involved in the development and implementation of a wide range of backend service development in C/C++ and Java, front-end web and Android app development, and the development of application software running on the Wave Relay¬Æ network. This position provides the opportunity to work alongside our team of highly skilled senior software engineers to develop technology that enables our customers to solve their most difficult networking problems.Position Responsibilities Use C/C++ to architect, develop, and implement backend API services Use Java to develop standalone web applications and android apps. Design, code, test, and document solutions to various software problems Take an active role in our code review process and software development cycle Collaborate with other developers and business leads to build solutions to new problems. Support internal and external engineering activities, including travel to test locations, military facilities, and customer sites to directly supporting the testing, evaluation, and deployment of the Wave Relay¬Æ system Job Qualifications & Experience Minimum Qualifications Computer Engineering degree At least 1 year of work/internship experience developing software for systems in C/C++ Experience with Java and JavaScript Experience with SQL databases (Preferably MS SQL Server, MySQL, Postgres, Oracle, or H2) Familiarity with JSON and REST APIs Experience with unit testing and dependency injection Must have a US Security Clearance or the ability to obtain one The pay for this role can vary from $110,000 to $130,000 a year based on the selected individual's education and experience. Persistent Systems, LLC offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; paid time off; flexible spending accounts; 401(k) plan with company match; fitness membership reimbursement; tuition assistance; mental health benefits; and veterinary benefits.Company OverviewHeadquartered in New York City since 2007, Persistent Systems, LLC is a global communications technology company which develops, manufactures, and integrates a patented and secure Mobile Ad Hoc Networking (MANET) system: Wave Relay¬Æ. The company‚Äôs industry leading R&D team has designed wireless networking protocols to support their cutting-edge Wave Relay¬Æ system and technology. Wave Relay¬Æ is capable of running data, video, voice and other applications under the most difficult and unpredictable conditions. Their suite of products is field proven and utilized in Commercial, Military, Government, Industrial, Agriculture, Robotics, and Unmanned System markets.

title: Software Engineer, Payments
description: Check is leading a revolution in the payroll industry. Payroll is the backbone of the US economy, and yet it has not undergone significant innovation in decades. We invented the embedded payroll space to change that (see: Check: Solving the $150 Billion Payroll Problem, Bank On It; Episode 438), both for the business owners who spend countless hours per week running payroll and for the millions of Americans who depend on their next paycheck. At Check, our mission is to empower the most innovative software platforms to create new payroll businesses, and enable those businesses to transform the way companies pay their employees.Check's culture is intensely caring: to each other as teammates, to our partners, and to the businesses and workers we serve. Our teams are made up of creative problem solvers and empathetic cross-functional collaborators who can simplify the complexities of payroll. We bring hustle and grit to our day-to-day, while building enduring solutions and relationships.Engineering is the core of Check. We believe payroll can and should be easy-to-use financial software, but getting there requires serious and sustained engineering effort. For our efforts, there is the deep satisfaction that comes from delivering people's paychecks on time and accurately. We are excited to bring on a new software engineer who will play a leading role in our payments engineering team.A large part of fulfilling Check's mission of "making payroll software" is ensuring that every payment is made in a timely and accurate manner, for every payroll. Check is a payroll company, and at the same time, it is a payments company. The payments system at Check must be highly reliable and robust, handle large volumes of money in and out, and have a high degree of accuracy and auditability in tracking funds and associated liabilities using our internal ledger.For this role, we are seeking an individual with strong, backend-oriented software engineering skills, a track record of building scalable and simple systems, an entrepreneurial mindset, and high personal integrity. We believe that someone with this combination will unlock new ideas, and solutions for our product, and gain the respect of our team.In this role, you will:Ship code that moves money between employers, employees, and tax agencies via ACH / Wire transfers, in a timely and accurate basis using our internal ledgerDistill the complexities of payment lifecycles into simple APIs for developers to use to holistic payroll systemsBuild frontend and backend components that improve customer integrationsInfluence the culture, values, and processes of a growing engineering teamCommunicate ideas and specifications through detailed, precise writingWork with our ops, design, sales, and legal functionsCommit on your first day, and deploy code continuouslySupport developers at customer companiesTeach and learn from other engineersInterview prospective candidatesMany backgrounds could fit this role, but ideal candidates will:Have built and scaled production web applicationsHave SQL and relational database experienceHave maintained or contributed to developer tools, SDKs, or open-source softwareHave demonstrated product and design sensibilitiesHave strong software engineering fundamentalsNice to haves:Built and scaled critical and time-sensitive systems with a high degree of required reliabilityExperience working on systems with multiple third-party vendor integrationsYou have worked at startups that have achieved market fit and are scaling upPrevious experience with non-ACH payment rails We use:Python (type-annotated) and Django for our APIReact and TypeScript for our frontendsPostgres for our databaseAWS for our cloud infrastructureGitLab for CI/CDJIRA and Confluence for project/information managementWhat we offer: At Check, we value transparency and trust. It's important to us that every employee and candidate feels confident that they'll be treated (and compensated) fairly on our team. The engineering team specifically operates on a flat titling system, meaning everyone is either a Software Engineer or an Engineering Manager. We structure our titles this way to maximize equity, inclusion, and opportunity within our team, and to minimize seniority bias. We want all engineers, regardless of job level, to feel empowered to lead projects they're passionate about and to collaborate with their fellow Checketeers as equals.To that end, we will consider candidates with a variety of backgrounds and levels of expertise for this role, and we will determine the appropriate job level for each candidate based on their unique experience and qualifications. The expected annual salary for this role is between $160,000 and $252,000, depending on the job level.In the US, Check offers company-sponsored medical, dental, vision, short-term/long-term disability, and basic life insurance coverage to all full-time employees, effective on their first day of work. We also provide stock options, flexible PTO and sick leave, 16 weeks of fully paid parental leave for all new parents flexible return-to-work, 9 annual holidays, a 401k retirement plan, and a $100 monthly stipend for home internet and mobile phone expenses. Benefits may vary outside the US.Check is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Check is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at hello@checkhq.com with "accommodations" in the subject line.Check participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with Form I-9 information from all new employees to confirm that they are authorized to work in the U.S. Check does not use E-Verify to pre-screen applicants.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description: As a Fullstack Engineer, you will have the unique opportunity to shape the DNA of our product. Given the no/low-code nature of our platform, we're seeking someone who is not only technically adept but also deeply passionate about creating an engaging, intuitive, and performant user interface.This will be a challenging and dynamic role, and you will be working at the forefront of distributed systems infrastructure and AI.What you should expect & examples of day-to-day tasks: - Move and iterate very quickly. - Developing sub-products within our platform from 0 to 1. - Working on infrastructure optimizations for VectorShift's platform. - Talking with customers to understanding core pain points and working with them on feature requests.ResponsibilitiesWork directly with the founders to conceptualize and implement sub-products and features, end to end.Lead technical architecture decisions, ensuring the platform is scalable and maintainable.Drive forward web performance optimization.Advocate for and implement UI/UX best practices, ensuring users are at the heart of every design decision.Incorporate user feedback to continuously iterate and refine the platform.Stay updated with the latest AI technologies / frameworks and integrate them where relevant into our platform.Establish foundational technical practices that will guide future team members.RequirementsDegree in a technical discipline, preferably computer science.Experience with Python/ FastAPI and React/NextJS or similar frontend frameworks.Experience with the entire web development process (design, development, and deployment).Understanding of web performance optimization and best practices.Familiarity with source control tools, preferably Git. Knowledge of responsive design.Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.Problem-solving aptitude and enthusiasm for overcoming challenges.Nice To HaveExperience in early-stage startup environments.Experience with no/low-code platforms.BenefitsHealth, dental, and vision insurance.Daily food stipend

title: Core Java Developer
description: Day-to-day ResponsibilitiesDevelop Core Java, Multithreaded and Spring based appllications.Must be able to work in a fast paced development along with the ability to multi-task.Proactively pick up open tasksThe candidate will be working on sprints with weekly releases and required attendance at daily Team Meetings.Work closely with a team member in other regions.Comply to standards of development and firm mandates.The Skills You Need To Get The JobExpert with Core Java, Multi-threading and Spring Boot.Minimum 10+ exp.Experienced in Microservices.Strong Database experience.Expert in Scripting Unix/Python.

title: Software Engineer - Platform
description: About UsWe're an early stage, well-funded startup team with a proven track record of shipping open source software with global adoption. We put a premium on respectful, clear, and complete communication, and we expect each other to be creative, curious, effective, and empathetic.We believe deeply that the right tools and abstractions enable not just technological transformation, but also organizational transformation. We strive to put the user and their hard work at the center of our decision making. In practice, that means we are looking for engineers who want to write clean APIs and helpful error messages, and who always try to understand user needs when designing a new system.All of our open source work is done publicly. You can gain context about how we collaborate as a team and the problems we work on by exploring GitHub and looking at our code reviews.About The RoleDagster is an orchestration platform for the development, production, and observation of data assets. Our goal is to make Dagster Cloud the de facto hosted solution for structuring these systems. In this role, you will drive improvements to Dagster's core architecture and infrastructure to keep it highly-performant at scale. You will design and implement new systems to support our development & clients needs. You will solve difficult technical problems throughout the software stack and work collaboratively with the rest of the team to plan and execute. You will instrument, monitor, debug, and optimize distributed systems from end to end. You will be setting new standards for enabling effective & productive development.This is a full-time, competitively paid position with benefits. We are a distributed team with offices in San Francisco and Minneapolis. We have team members all over the U.S. and we are hiring fully remote candidates in the U.S. Every employee is provided a remote work stipend to cover the cost of home office equipment and anything else that makes your remote work location comfortable, productive, or successful. And if you'd rather not work from home, we'll cover the cost of a coworking or office space if you're fully remote.Must-have Qualifications7+ years of proven experience in large scale software development3+ years of experience building and scaling services built on Amazon Web Services, Kubernetes & PostgresStrong written and oral communication skillsYou can confidently manage a complex engineering project from design through completionExperience in a high-functioning engineering organization working on large-scale distributed systems or B2B SaaS applications. Nice-to-have QualificationsExperience with using or supporting tools in the Modern Data Stack. 'Experience with a wide range of modern infrastructure tools and technologiesYou belong hereWe are committed to building an inclusive team and an open source community where no one feels out of place. We know that teams with diverse backgrounds state their assumptions more explicitly, think more rigorously, and build better software. Plus it's more fun and interesting to work with a wide variety of perspectives.You should apply to work at Dagster Labs if you want to work in, and help to build and strengthen, a high-performing software development environment where people of all backgrounds are welcome.Our StackDagster is built in Python and TypeScript to work on macOS, Posix, and Windows. We use GraphQL, Apollo, and React to develop beautiful frontend tooling. We integrate with a wide range of databases, data warehouses, orchestration engines, compute substrates, and cloud services.The estimated annual cash salary for this role is $160,000 - $210,000.Other resources:The launch of Dagster blog postLaunching Dagster Cloud to GA blog postDagster Day 2022 video playlistOur latest major releaseSoftware-Defined Assets blog post, Data Council talk, and animated explainerOur latest episode on the Data Engineering PodcastOur philosophy on code reviews
